title: Calories in a Tamale
meta_description: Learn calories in a tamale with a full nutrition breakdown, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and tweaks for different fillings or preparations.
assumptions: Traditional steamed pork tamale with corn masa dough, about 142 g; includes filling and husk removed.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by filling (pork, chicken, veggie), size, recipe, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical pork tamale provides ~223 kcal, 7 g protein, and 27 g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian bean filling instead of pork
Add 1 oz shredded cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories in a tamale?
faqs.a: About 223 kcal for a standard pork tamale.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a tamale?
faqs.a: Roughly 27 g carbs, 7 g protein, 10 g fat per tamale.
Yes, around 400 mg sodium per tamale due to seasonings and filling.

faqs.q: How do veggie tamales compare in calories?
faqs.a: Typically 40-50 kcal less than meat-filled versions, around 180 kcal.
Yes; smaller tamales (~100 g) have fewer calories, larger ones more.
